title: Zetta.net Appoints Mike Grossman CEO
text:
Submitted by admin on 9/8/2015 @ 1:00 PM Companies mentioned in this article: Zetta.net 
SUNNYVALE, CA -- (Marketwired) -- 09/08/15 -- Zetta.net today announced the appointment of Mike Grossman as CEO. The online business and software-industry visionary joins the company following his role as CEO of SugarSync. As CEO of Zetta.net, Grossman will help usher the company to new levels of growth and international expansion. Grossman succeeds Ali Jenab who will remain Zetta.net's Chairman of the Board. 
The cloud is quickly transforming critical business operations, including backup and disaster recovery (DR). As organizations seek to achieve higher levels of data protection and recovery, Zetta.net is rapidly meeting their needs with a software-only approach that simplifies backups, speeds data recovery and reduces overall cost for customers with volumes of data. The Zetta.net DataProtect solution, which is embraced by small and medium enterprises and managed service providers (MSPs) alike, is changing the game for backup and recovery. 
"There is a DR-as-a-Service revolution that is swiftly driving massive new opportunities for companies that can quickly act with the innovative technology and operational infrastructure companies need to deliver cost-effective DR protection," said Grossman. "Zetta.net is perfectly poised to capitalize on this opportunity with a cloud-based DR approach that enables disaster readiness for any size organization, with the speed and agility to recover even the largest of data sets without cumbersome appliances. I look forward to helping chart the company's continued advancements during such a pivotal time in the history of the cloud." 
Jenab has successfully led Zetta.net's growth since 2010. During this time he drove exponential revenue achievements and explosive triple digit expansion in both the company's number of customers and MSP partners. Under Jenab's guidance, the company has also been awarded volumes of industry awards and accolades. His expertise will remain with the company as he continues in the role of Chairman of the Board. 
"Mike is the ideal leader as Zetta.net moves to its next phase of growth," said Jenab. "His proven track record in building and leading successful organizations will clearly benefit Zetta.net as we continue to execute on our growth strategy and move into international regions." 
Grossman brings nearly 30 years of product innovation, brand building, organizational expansion and corporate strategy and development experience to his new role at Zetta.net. Most recently, he was CEO for SugarSync where his transformative strategy achieved strong growth, attracting its acquisition by j2 Global in March 2015. He has also served as CEO for Attributor, Tempo Payments and LiveCapital and has held executive and leadership positions with Intuit and McKinsey & Company. Grossman received a degree in economics and a law degree from Harvard University. 
About Zetta.net Zetta.net is an award-winning provider of enterprise-grade cloud backup and DRaaS solutions for small/medium enterprises and managed service providers (MSPs). Its software-only approach with built-in WAN acceleration enables companies to simplify backups, speed data recovery and reduce overall cost.
